intro: Paraboea brunnescens, commonly known as the brown-flowered paraboea, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes many species of shrubs and herbs. The plant typically grows as a climbing vine with opposite, ovate leaves that are often pubescent. Its flowers are small, clustered in inflorescences, and have a yellowish or brownish hue. It is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forests and undergrowth.
